Bash(git commit -m "Add online multiplayer and improve ball physics

- Fixed ball physics with reduced gravity and speed
- Added online multiplayer using PeerJS
- Create/join room system with room codes
- Real-time game synchronization between players
- Ping monitoring for connection quality
- Both local and online play modes
- Improved UI with menu system

Players can now play from different computers!")

Bash(git commit -m "Fix slime semicircle orientation

- Slimes now properly display as semicircles sitting on ground
- Eyes positioned correctly on top of slime
- Fixed collision detection to match visual representation")

Bash(git commit -m "Fix ball physics and multiplayer sync

- Further reduced ball gravity (0.15) and speed
- Fixed ball collision response for more realistic bounces
- Fixed multiplayer synchronization - both players now visible to each other
- Host sends game state, guest sends their position
- Proper bi-directional sync between players")

Bash(git commit -m "Drastically reduce ball physics speed

- Reduced ball gravity to 0.08 (from 0.15)
- Reduced initial ball velocity
- Added velocity cap of 8 units max
- Reduced bounce coefficients
- Made slime collisions much softer
- Ball should now move at a playable speed")

Bash(git commit -m "Adapt physics to classic Slime Soccer feel

- Increased ball gravity to 0.2 for more realistic arc
- Better bounce coefficients (65% vertical, 85% horizontal)
- Improved slime collision with directional response
- Slime movement slightly slower for better control
- Ball responds to slime impact force and direction
- More authentic classic arcade physics feel")

Bash(git commit -m "Add version number v1.0.5 to menu screen

- Added version display below title
- Shows v1.0.5 so users know when refresh worked
- Styled with monospace font in gray")

Bash(git commit -m "Drastically slow down ball physics (v1.0.6)

- Reduced ball gravity to 0.1 (half of previous)
- Reduced max velocity cap to 5 (from 10)
- Simplified collision to fixed gentle push
- Reduced all bounce and friction factors
- Ball should now move much slower and more controlled")

Bash(git commit -m "EXTREME ball physics reduction (v1.0.7)

- Ball gravity: 0.05 (was 0.1) - extremely slow fall
- Max velocity: 3 (was 5) - much slower movement  
- Added 0.99 damping to continuously slow ball down
- Ground bounce: 40% (was 60%)
- Wall bounce: 50% (was 70%)
- Collision force: 1.5 (was 3)
- Ball should now be MUCH slower and controlled")

Bash(git commit -m "Fix 60fps physics issue (v1.0.8)

FOUND THE PROBLEM: Physics were calculated for 60fps but values were too high

- Ball gravity: 0.008 (was 0.05) - proper for 60fps
- Max velocity: 1 (was 3) - appropriate for frame rate  
- Collision force: 0.3 (was 1.5) - much gentler
- Initial velocity: 0.1 (was 0.5) - barely moving
- Ball should finally be slow and controllable")

Bash(git commit -m "Make ball more bouncy and improve gameplay (v1.0.9)

- Ball now starts randomly on left or right side (no more net rushing!)
- Much more bouncy: 70% ground bounce (was 40%), 80% wall bounce (was 50%)
- Improved slime collision response for better ball control
- Less ground friction so ball keeps moving
- Higher starting drop position for better action")

Bash(git commit -m "Massively increase slime collision power and fix ball start position (v1.1.0)

- Slime collision force increased 3x (0.4 -> 1.2) for 200%+ power boost
- Slime velocity influence tripled for better ball control
- Increased max ball velocity to 2 for faster action
- Fixed ball starting position with explicit coordinates (150 or 650)
- Added debug logging to track ball start position
- Ball should now launch much faster from slime hits")

Bash(git commit -m "MASSIVE collision power increase and debug ball spawning (v1.1.1)

- Collision force now 2.5 (was 1.2) - should launch ball way over net
- Slime velocity influence increased to 60% for powerful shots
- Max ball velocity raised to 4 for long-distance shots  
- Added detailed debug logging for ball spawn position
- Ball should now fly far when hit by slimes
- Debug logs will show if ball spawning works correctly")
